alert.note: Alert for Dickinson; Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 8:04PM EDT until April 24 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity for the following rivers in Michigan... Michigamme River near Witch Lake affecting Dickinson and Marquette Counties. .High water along the Michigamme River near Witch Lake due to recent rain and snow melt is still ongoing. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Michigamme River near Witch Lake. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flood waters cover significant portions of County Road LG between M-95 and Michigamme Dam. Houses near Bengtson Bridge in South Republic are further impacted by flood waters * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:10 PM CDT Monday /7:10 PM EDT Monday/ the stage was 11.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:10 PM CDT Monday /7:10 PM EDT Monday/ was 11.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.6 feet on 05/11/1965. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Tuesday morning at 1100 AM CDT /1200 PM EDT/.
